description: A command injection vulnerability was discovered in the fcn.0000ec7c function of cgibin. When processing HTTP request parameters, the program retrieves user input via getenv and constructs a command string using sprintf, which is then directly passed to the system function for execution. Attackers can inject arbitrary commands by carefully crafting HTTP parameters.
Multiple unvalidated system calls detected, which utilize fixed string parameters and could potentially be exploited for attacks if other parts of the program are compromised by an attacker.

The HTTP request handling function fcn.0000ec7c retrieves multiple environment variables (such as QUERY_STRING) through getenv, which may contain user-provided input but lacks sufficient input validation.
